forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind 14 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 11am, then a chance of showers and thunderstorms between 11am and 2pm, then a chance of rain between 2pm and 5pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 56. West wind 16 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle shroud of clouds drapes the sky, blending shades of gray with hints of impending rain. The air carries a crispness, inviting a sense of briskness as temperatures linger around 50 degrees. A faint sigh of wind whispers through the streets, a portent of the shifting weather patterns on the horizon. While a slight chance of rain lingers in the night, it promises to remain an unobtrusive companion, with only a trace of moisture expected as we turn toward tomorrow.

Tuesday beckons with playful uncertainty, as clouds promise showers and perhaps even a thunderstorm. Daylight will filter through partly sunny skies, creating a contrast that mirrors the urban landscape—vibrant yet subdued. Clad in layers, one might find comfort in a light jacket, perhaps with a hood to guard against any playful splashes from above. Consider a stroll through the winding streets, or perhaps a quiet cafe visit, as you savor the moodiness that accompanies such weather. The day might just tempt you to embrace the shroud of clouds and rain, making comfort your ally.
